name: Test yourself! Take this Foul Play Quiz |     Movies

questions.text: What was Goldie Hawn's character's name?
questions.explanation:
Gloria Mundy.

	This was the first film that Goldie starred in with Chevy Chase.  Their second collaboration was the 1980 film "Seems Like Old Times".

questions.text: Who played the role of Stanley Tibbets?
questions.explanation:
Dudley Moore.

	Dudley played this sex-crazed music conductor.  Dudley died of pneumonia as a result of progressive supranuclear palsy on March 27, 2002.  Interesting to note Billy Wilder and Milton Berle also died on the same day.

questions.text: What was the name of Mr. Hennessey's pet snake?
questions.explanation:
Esme.

	Burgess Meredith played Gloria's lovable Kung-fu fighting landlord.  If you will recall, he told Esme she was a bad girl because she tried to eat the cigarettes.

questions.text: What was the color of the bridesmaid's dress, worn by Goldie's character?
questions.explanation:
Lavender.

	Gloria said that she would also wear this dress for a night out on the town.

questions.text: Who was Goldie's character told to "beware of..."?
questions.explanation:
the dwarf.

	Gloria was told to "beware of the dwarf" on her date with Scotty, just before he died in the movie theater.

questions.text: Where did Goldie's character meet Bob Scott for their date?
questions.explanation:
at a movie theater.

	Scotty was late getting there because he had been stabbed.  No one would believe Gloria that she had a date or that he was even dead.

in a pack of cigarettes.

	Scotty gave Gloria the cigarettes containing the microfilm, because he knew he was being followed.  He asked Gloria to hold onto them, because he was trying to cut down on smoking.

questions.text: What prominent figure was coming for a visit to San Francisco?
options: The President of the United States
questions.explanation:
The Pope.

	The Pope was to be assassinated by Delia Darrow and the Archbishop's twin brother.

questions.text: What was the name of the opera, that the Pope was there to see, while he was in town?
questions.explanation:
The Mikado.

	He was completely oblivious to the events that were going on around him.

questions.text: What was the name of the character played by Chevy Chase?
questions.explanation:
Tony Carlson.

	This film gave Chevy Chase a chance to show his true comedic side, minus all of his bumbling and stumbling falls.
